remarks: A suffix of a concatenation is either a suffix of the second concatenated word or a concatenation of a suffix of the first word with the second word.  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 31-Mar-2018.)  (Revised by Alexander van der Vekens, 30-May-2018.)
statement:
swrdccatin12.l $e |- L = ( # ` A ) $.
swrdccat3b $p |- ( ( A e. Word V /\ B e. Word V ) -> ( M e. ( 0 ... ( L + ( # ` B ) ) ) -> ( ( A ++ B ) substr <. M , ( L + ( # ` B ) ) >. ) = if ( L <_ M , ( B substr <. ( M - L ) , ( # ` B ) >. ) , ( ( A substr <. M , L >. ) ++ B ) ) ) ) $.
